name: capitulation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of accepting defeat: To withdraw the remaining troops would have been a humiliating capitulation. Some say withdrawal of the military forces represented a capitulation to terrorism.
an occasion when someone unwillingly accepts or agrees to do something: We are seeing hopelessness and capitulation among investors. See
capitulate
More examplesFewer examplesAdvocates of peace-at-any-price were proposing capitulation.They should never fear to negotiate, but they’ll be criticized by those who confuse negotiation with capitulation.Negotiators had to walk a delicate line between capitulation to the hijackers and appearing callous about the hostages.Those on the right are likely to portray any compromise as a capitulation born of weakness.
